Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Reorganize benchmarks and add script to run them" (#495) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Reorganize benchmarks and add script to run them" (#495) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Add OpenXmlElement.StrictTranslateAttribute to handle strict translation" (#494) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This change removes the race conditions that could be encountered when parsing attributes when strict translation is on. Instead of a dictionary of types that it applies to, this adds an overload to OpenXmlElement to handle any strict translation needed by the attributes. This way, the type itself can opt into any strict translation that it requires.

Fixes #480

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "static method AttributeTranslator.DicOfTranslators is not thread safe" (#480) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
![default](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/991922/38667774-f6e171e8-3e4a-11e8-929a-48dfa5398f2d.png)
When loading excel files from different threads this method can be executed at same time. On screenshot we got race condition when inserting tblLook in non thread safe class Dictionary

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add support for emf/wmf images conversion into html " (#222) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
It's known issue that GDI consumes huge amounts of memory when dealing with emf/wmf.

On the other hand, image/x-emf, image/x-wmf are valid types of images in both OpenXML and RTF specs.

While it still possible to replace these images with converted analogs using OpenXML SDK, it would be useful to allow convert a document with them into html (instead of just ignoring silently).
It's much simpler to convert them into another format in ImageHandler(png, for instance, because Chrome and Firefox don't understand emf/wmf formats), instead of replacing the ImagePart.

Moreover, the changes are really small, and, as the benefit, give the responsibility to the consumer what to do with these formats (they can be ignored as well).

Thanks in advance
